context: Swarm intelligence pattern - JSONL append-only + jq/MCP retrieval
lesson: use append-only JSONL per repo; agents never read full logs into context; retrieval is keyword/semantic via jq/MCP returning top-5 summaries to keep context small

context: Making code portable for OSS - environment variables vs hardcoded paths
lesson: when creating OSS from internal code replace hardcoded paths like /Users/jedi/path with env vars like $AGENT_SWARM_PATH - add .gitignore to block private data (logs/*.jsonl) - document setup in README requiring users to export env var

context: When agents should log memories to swarm system
lesson: ALWAYS log at task boundaries: after completing task (state UX intent fulfilled) after learning code intent (WHY at any level) after overcoming error after resolving misunderstanding after discovering pattern - capture intent at appropriate abstraction level (component module feature system organism) - holonic nature matters

context: Starting comprehensive ixcoach-api documentation ingestion task
lesson: Agent initiated full scan of ixcoach-api/docs to create modular memories with file timestamps, summaries, tags, and atomic insights for high-value documents

context: Doc ingestion progress: logged 3 index files
lesson: Successfully logged DOCS_MAP (doc organization system), initiatives-map (8 WIP strategic initiatives), and issues INDEX (webhook/auth/subscription issues catalog) to memory. Next: process high-value system docs (auth flows, payment journeys, API guides)

context: When agent completes session diagnostics and security protocol documentation
lesson: Agent captured 13 critical memories: (1-6) Canonical logging flow - session-scoped uses logAdminOnlyConversationAspect, operational uses recordAdminLog, severity metadata structure, validation protocol, production behavior, (7-9) Session diagnostics UI - timeline filtering, tag definitions, incomplete /admin/admin-logs UI, (10-13) Admin security - gen3SecureAdminVerification mandatory for all admin features, requireFullAdmin for privilege levels, simulateNonAdmin blocks admin access, withGen3SecureAdminAuth HOC pattern. context: When agent completes gen4 feature audit for gptcoach2
lesson: Agent documented 11 gen4 features: (1) Feature flag system with 3 status levels, (2) AdminFeatureDashboard showing grouped features, (3) GlobalThemeModal with live preview, (4-6) WIP features: MOOD_TRACKER (incomplete UI), MEMORIES (incomplete UI), STATUS_MANAGEMENT (partial - UI exists, backend may be incomplete), (7) COACHES_PAGES partial implementation, (8) COUNSELORS_PAGES partial implementation, (9) AdminChangelogPage fully implemented, (10) AdminNotificationsPage fully implemented with targeting, (11) ChangelogEmailComposerPage integration. context: When agent corrects gen4 misconception in institutional memory
lesson: Agent corrected critical misconception: Gen4 does not exist. The src/gen4 directory is an anti-pattern from past agent confusion. All components are Gen3. Added 2 corrective memories explaining that gen4 references should be treated as misplaced Gen3 code. Previous memories mentioning gen4 should be interpreted as Gen3 features that were incorrectly organized. Total: 105 atomic memories.
